org.corfudb.runtime.stream

Interface IStream

  • All Superinterfaces:
    AutoCloseable
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    IHopStream
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    SimpleStream

    public interface IStream
extends AutoCloseable
    A stream interface. Streams are slightly more restrictive than logs: Random reads are only possible when given a timestamp, and they must be read starting from the head of the stream.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      ITimestamp append(Serializable data)
      Append an object to the stream.
      default ITimestamp check()
      Returns a fresh timestamp, which can serve as a linearization point.
      ITimestamp check(boolean cached)
      Returns a fresh or cached timestamp, which can serve as a linearization point.
      void close()
      Close the stream.
      ITimestamp getCurrentPosition()
      Gets the current position the stream has read to (which may not point to an entry in the stream).
      UUID getStreamID()
      Get the ID of the stream.
      IStreamEntry readNextEntry()
      Read the next entry in the stream as a IStreamEntry.
      default Object readNextObject()
      Read the next entry in the stream as an Object.
      void trim(ITimestamp address)
      Requests a trim on this stream.

    • Method Detail

      • append

        ITimestamp append(Serializable data)
           throws OutOfSpaceException,
                  IOException
        Append an object to the stream. This operation may or may not be successful. For example, a move operation may occur, and the append will not be part of the stream.
        Parameters:
        data - A serializable object to append to the stream.
        Returns:
        A timestamp, which reflects the physical position and the epoch the data was written in.
        Throws:
        OutOfSpaceException
        IOException

      • readNextEntry

        IStreamEntry readNextEntry()
                    throws HoleEncounteredException,
                           TrimmedException,
                           IOException
        Read the next entry in the stream as a IStreamEntry. This function retrieves the next entry in the stream, or null, if there are no more entries in the stream.
        Returns:
        A CorfuDBStreamEntry containing the payload of the next entry in the stream.
        Throws:
        HoleEncounteredException
        TrimmedException
        IOException

      • readNextObject

        default Object readNextObject()
                       throws HoleEncounteredException,
                              TrimmedException,
                              IOException,
                              InterruptedException,
                              ClassNotFoundException
        Read the next entry in the stream as an Object. This convenience function retrieves the next entry in the stream, blocking if necessary.
        Returns:
        A deserialized object containing the payload of the next entry in the stream.
        Throws:
        HoleEncounteredException
        TrimmedException
        IOException
        InterruptedException
        ClassNotFoundException

      • check

        default ITimestamp check()
        Returns a fresh timestamp, which can serve as a linearization point. This function may return a non-linearizable (invalid) timestamp which may never occur in the ordering due to a move/epoch change.
        Returns:
        A timestamp, which reflects the most recently allocated timestamp in the stream.

      • check

        ITimestamp check(boolean cached)
        Returns a fresh or cached timestamp, which can serve as a linearization point. This function may return a non-linearizable (invalid) timestamp which may never occur in the ordering due to a move/epoch change.
        Parameters:
        cached - Whether or not the timestamp returned is cached.
        Returns:
        A timestamp, which reflects the most recently allocated timestamp in the stream, or currently read, depending on whether cached is set or not.

      • getCurrentPosition

        ITimestamp getCurrentPosition()
        Gets the current position the stream has read to (which may not point to an entry in the stream).
        Returns:
        A timestamp, which reflects the most recently read address in the stream.

      • trim

        void trim(ITimestamp address)
        Requests a trim on this stream. This function informs the configuration master that the position on this stream is trimmable, and moves the start position of this stream to the new position.

      • close

        void close()
        Close the stream. This method must be called to free resources.
        Specified by:
        close in interface AutoCloseable

      • getStreamID

        UUID getStreamID()
        Get the ID of the stream.
        Returns:
        The ID of the stream.
